hero.title: True Multiplayer Work
hero.subtitle: We built this because we were tired of saying "Can you see my screen?" and because "it works on my machine" shouldn't be a punchline.

problem.title: You've Been in This Meeting
problem.scenario1: Someone shares their screen. "Can everyone see this?" Half the team is multitasking. The other half is watching passively. Nobody's actually engaged because watching someone else work is fundamentally boring.
problem.scenario2: Or worse: You're debugging with a teammate over Slack. They describe what they're seeing. You paste terminal commands. Twenty messages later, you're both frustrated and the bug is still there.
problem.scenario3: Or: You're setting up a demo environment. Again. For the third time this week. Because the last one disappeared when you closed your laptop.
problem.truth: The tools we use for collaboration were revolutionary in 2010. But it's 2026, and we're still taking turns with a single cursor like it's a microphone at a karaoke bar.

insight.title: What If You Didn't Have to Take Turns?
questions: What if instead of sharing your screen, you shared your entire computer—and everyone could type at the same time?
What if your environment didn't vanish when you closed your laptop?
What if reproducing a bug didn't require 15 screenshots and a Loom video?
What if browser automation didn't require writing code?

story.title: How This Started
story.year2017: Back in 2017, I was working at a startup that needed to automate interactions with third-party websites. We built an API that could spawn browsers and run scripts—login flows, data extraction, UI automation.
story.pivot: The startup shut down. But I kept building because the core idea felt valuable.
story.year2025: Fast forward to 2025. AI agents were everywhere. I thought: what if this browser automation platform had AI built in? Users could record their workflows and let AI handle the messy parts—adapting to website changes, dealing with errors, completing the task.
story.realization: Then I realized: why limit this to browsers? Why not offer the full desktop? Make it collaborative. Add multi-cursor support so teams can work in parallel. Make it a sandbox where AI agents can actually do things.
story.present: That's Cyqle today. A genuinely multiplayer cloud computer with AI automation baked in.

solution.title: A Full Linux Desktop That Doesn't Disappear
solution.paragraph1: Cyqle is a real Linux environment in the cloud. But instead of one person driving while others watch, everyone works simultaneously. Multiple people typing in parallel, each with their own cursor and window focus.
solution.paragraph2: It's not screen sharing. It's not a VM you SSH into alone. It's a genuinely multiplayer computer that you can spin up in seconds, collaborate on in real-time, then close—or persist and resume from any device.
painPoints: "Can you see my screen?" (they're already there)
Describing bugs over chat (just invite them in)
"It works on my machine" (use the same machine)
Rebuilding demo environments (snapshot and reuse them)
Writing automation scripts for simple tasks (just record it)

difference.title: Why This Hasn't Existed Before
difference.intro: Building a multiplayer cloud desktop isn't just hard—it's a stack of hard problems nobody wanted to solve:
challenges: True P2P streaming without central server bottlenecks
Instant provisioning without the overhead of traditional virtualization
Multi-cursor support at the system level (most platforms aren't designed for this)
Per-session isolation without nested container complexity
Encryption that actually destroys data when you close an ephemeral session
difference.conclusion: We spent years solving these so you don't have to think about them. You just get a computer that works, in the cloud, with your whole team on it at once.

Screen sharing feels like working with one hand tied behind your back
"Works on my machine" has bitten you more than once
You've ever wanted to collaborate on the same terminal without complex session sharing
You're building AI agents and need a safe sandbox to deploy them

vision.title: The Future We're Building
vision.intro: We believe the future of work isn't about better video calls. It's about shared context. Ephemeral environments you spin up for a task and throw away. Automation that doesn't require engineering degrees.
future: Teams collaborate on the same machine without friction or lag
AI agents work alongside humans, handling repetitive tasks while you focus on what matters
Your work environment is as portable as your email—access it from anywhere, exactly as you left it
Security doesn't mean locking people out—it means isolated environments that vanish when you're done

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.introduction: At Cyqle, we are committed to protecting your privacy and providing transparent information about how we collect, use, and protect your data. This Privacy Policy complies with 2026 privacy regulations including GDPR, CCPA, and the EU AI Act.
privacyPolicy.privacy3Banner: Privacy 3.0 Compliant - Full Transparency & User Control

ephemeral.title: Ephemeral by Default
ephemeral.description: Session data is wiped instantly when you close unless you enable persistence

aiTransparency.title: AI Disclosure
aiTransparency.description: We clearly disclose when AI systems are used and how they work

p2p.title: P2P Architecture
p2p.description: Your data may transit through peer nodes with Standard Contractual Clauses

rights.description: Full access, deletion, portability, and objection rights under GDPR/CCPA

dataCollection.title: 1. Data Collection & Legal Basis
dataCollection.intro: We distinguish between two primary categories of data: Account Data (necessary for billing and account management) and Session Data (ephemeral data generated within your virtual desktop environment).

accountData.title: Account Data (Persistent)
accountData.description: We collect and store the following information to manage your account and provide billing services:
accountData.item2: Payment information (processed securely via Stripe - we do not store full credit card numbers)
accountData.item3: Account preferences and subscription tier selections
accountData.item4: Billing history and usage logs for invoicing purposes
accountData.legalBasis: Legal Basis: Contractual Necessity - This data is required to fulfill our contract with you to provide the Cyqle service.

sessionData.title: Session Data (Ephemeral)
sessionData.description: Data generated during your use of virtual desktop sessions. This category is inherently ephemeral due to our jailed environment architecture:
sessionData.item1: Files, documents, and code created within your session's isolated filesystem
sessionData.item2: Installed software packages and system configuration changes
sessionData.item4: Network activity originating from your session (for security monitoring only)
sessionData.legalBasis: Legal Basis: Contractual Necessity - Processing session data is essential to provide you with an isolated, functional virtual desktop environment.
sessionData.ephemeralNote: Important: Session data in ephemeral sessions is encrypted with unique, per-session keys and is cryptographically erased upon session termination. This data cannot be recovered after deletion.
sessionData.noAccessNote: Critical Privacy Guarantee: Cyqle does NOT have access to or interfere with anything inside your jailed session. We cannot read your files, access your data, or monitor your activities within the session. The only operational data we may collect is anonymized logging (session duration, resource usage) and only when you expressly allow us (bug reports, support requests).

technicalData.title: Technical & Diagnostic Data
technicalData.description: We collect limited technical data to maintain platform stability and security:
technicalData.item1: IP addresses (hashed after 24 hours for fraud prevention)
technicalData.item2: Browser type and operating system (for compatibility diagnostics)
technicalData.item3: Session start/end timestamps and resource usage metrics (for capacity planning)
technicalData.legalBasis: Legal Basis: Legitimate Interest - We have a legitimate interest in maintaining platform security, preventing fraud, and optimizing service performance.

aiTransparency.title: 2. AI Transparency (EU AI Act Compliance)
aiTransparency.intro: Cyqle incorporates AI-powered features to enhance your productivity. Under the 2026 EU AI Act, we are required to provide clear disclosure when you interact with or are affected by AI systems.

disclosure.title: AI Operator Disclosure
disclosure.description: When you use Cyqle's automation features (browser recording, task delegation, workflow scheduling), you may interact with our "AI Operator" - an AI system designed to execute repetitive web tasks on your behalf.

howItWorks.title: How the AI Operator Works
howItWorks.description: The AI Operator uses the following logic to assist you:
howItWorks.item1: Pattern Recognition: It analyzes recorded browser interactions to identify actionable patterns (clicks, form fills, navigation sequences)
howItWorks.item2: Task Execution: Based on your instructions, it replicates these patterns to automate repetitive tasks
howItWorks.item3: Contextual Adaptation: It uses computer vision and DOM analysis to adapt to minor UI changes in web applications
howItWorks.item4: Feedback Loop: You can review, approve, or modify automated actions before they execute

humanOversight.title: Human Oversight & Limitations
humanOversight.description: The AI Operator operates under your direct supervision. It does not make autonomous decisions that affect your account, billing, or access rights. All critical operations require explicit user confirmation. The AI does not access or process your session data for training purposes without explicit opt-in consent.

automatedDecisions.title: 3. Automated Decision-Making (ADMT)
automatedDecisions.intro: Cyqle uses limited automated decision-making systems to ensure platform security and fair resource allocation. Under 2026 CCPA requirements, you have the right to opt out of certain automated processing.

fraud.title: Fraud Detection:
fraud.description: Our system analyzes account creation patterns, payment behaviors, and IP reputation scores to detect and prevent fraudulent sign-ups. False positives are reviewed by human operators within 24 hours.

allocation.title: Session Allocation:
allocation.description: An automated load balancer allocates your session to available infrastructure nodes based on current capacity, geographic proximity, and subscription tier priority.

abuse.title: Abuse Detection:
abuse.description: We monitor resource consumption patterns (CPU, memory, network) to detect violations of our Acceptable Use Policy (e.g., cryptocurrency mining, DDoS attacks).

optOut.title: Your Right to Opt-Out & Human Review
optOut.description: If an automated system flags your account or denies access, you have the right to request human review and contest the decision. You may also opt out of certain automated processing (excluding critical security functions).
optOut.contact: To exercise this right, contact privacy@cyqle.in with your account email and the subject line: "ADMT Opt-Out Request."

internationalTransfers.title: 4. International Data Transfers
internationalTransfers.intro: Cyqle's peer-to-peer (P2P) architecture means that session data may transit through various geographic nodes during real-time collaboration. We take specific measures to ensure compliance with international data transfer regulations.

p2pNature.title: P2P Mesh Network & Data Routing
p2pNature.description: When you collaborate with other users in real-time, your session data is transmitted directly between peers using libp2p. This means:
p2pNature.item1: Data may be routed through intermediate relay nodes located in different countries
p2pNature.item2: The exact path of data transmission depends on network topology and peer availability
p2pNature.item3: All P2P connections are end-to-end encrypted using TLS 1.3 and WebRTC encryption

safeguards.title: Cross-Border Transfer Safeguards
safeguards.description: To protect your data during international transfers, we implement the following safeguards:
safeguards.item1: Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs): All data transfers to countries outside the EEA are governed by EU-approved Standard Contractual Clauses (2021/914)
safeguards.item2: Encryption in Transit: All data is encrypted during transmission using industry-standard encryption protocols
safeguards.item3: Data Minimization: Only the minimum necessary session data is transmitted through the P2P network (screen frames, input events, authentication tokens)

accountability.title: Your Control Over Data Location
accountability.description: While we cannot guarantee the exact geographic path of P2P-routed data, you can control where your persistent session data is stored by selecting your preferred data center region in your account settings (available for Pro and Power tier users).

retention.title: 5. Data Retention & Deletion
retention.intro: One of Cyqle's core privacy features is the ephemeral nature of our jailed environment architecture. Here's exactly how we handle data retention and deletion:

ephemeral.title: Ephemeral Sessions (Default Behavior)
ephemeral.description: By default, all sessions are ephemeral. This means:
ephemeral.item1: Session Encryption: Your session's writable filesystem is encrypted with a unique, randomly-generated AES-256 key created at session start
ephemeral.item2: Instant Deletion: When you close the session, the encryption key is immediately destroyed, rendering all session data cryptographically irrecoverable
ephemeral.item3: Zero Retention: No session files, installed software, or user-generated content is retained after session termination

persistent.title: Persistent Sessions (Optional, Paid Tiers Only)
persistent.description: If you enable persistence (available on Lite, Pro, and Power tiers), your session data is retained as follows:
persistent.item1: Storage Duration: Persistent data is retained for the duration specified by your subscription tier (e.g., 30 days for Lite, 90 days for Pro)
persistent.item2: Encrypted Storage: Persistent data is stored in encrypted block storage with unique per-user encryption keys managed via AWS KMS
persistent.item3: Manual Deletion: You can manually delete persistent sessions at any time through your dashboard

accountData.title: Account Data Retention
accountData.description: Account data (email, billing information, usage logs) is retained for as long as your account is active, plus an additional 90 days after account closure to comply with financial record-keeping requirements. After this period, all personal identifiers are permanently deleted.

deletion.title: Your Right to Deletion
deletion.description: You may request deletion of all your personal data at any time by contacting privacy@cyqle.in. We will complete your deletion request within 30 days, except where retention is required by law (e.g., tax records, fraud prevention).

rights.title: 6. Your Privacy Rights
rights.intro: Under GDPR (for EEA residents) and CCPA (for California residents), you have the following rights regarding your personal data:

access.title: Right to Access
access.description: You can request a copy of all personal data we hold about you

rectification.title: Right to Rectification
rectification.description: You can update or correct inaccurate personal information

erasure.title: Right to Erasure ("Right to be Forgotten")
erasure.description: You can request deletion of your personal data

portability.title: Right to Data Portability
portability.description: You can request your data in a machine-readable format

objection.title: Right to Object
objection.description: You can object to certain types of processing (e.g., marketing)

restriction.title: Right to Restriction
restriction.description: You can request that we limit how we use your data

rights.exercise: To exercise any of these rights, email privacy@cyqle.in with your account email and specify which right you wish to exercise. We will respond within 30 days.

security.title: 7. Security Measures
security.intro: We implement industry-leading security measures to protect your data from unauthorized access, disclosure, or destruction:

measures.title: Security Controls
measures.item1: Encryption: All data is encrypted in transit (TLS 1.3) and at rest (AES-256)
measures.item2: Isolation: Each session runs in a jailed environment with strict process and filesystem isolation (see SESSION_ENVIRONMENT.md)
measures.item3: Access Controls: Role-based access controls (RBAC) limit employee access to production data
measures.item4: Security Audits: We conduct annual third-party security audits and penetration testing
measures.item5: Incident Response: We maintain a 24/7 incident response team for security events

breach.title: Data Breach Notification
breach.description: In the unlikely event of a data breach affecting your personal information, we will notify you within 72 hours via email and provide details about the nature of the breach, affected data categories, and remediation steps.

cookies.title: 8. Cookies & Tracking Technologies
cookies.intro: Cyqle uses minimal cookies and tracking technologies. We do not use third-party advertising trackers or sell your data to data brokers.

essential.title: Essential Cookies (Required)
essential.description: Session authentication token (httpOnly, secure, sameSite=strict) - expires after 30 days or logout

analytics.title: Analytics Cookies (Optional)
analytics.description: We use privacy-respecting analytics (Plausible Analytics) that does not track individual users or use cookies. You can opt out via your browser's Do Not Track (DNT) header.

changes.title: 9. Changes to This Privacy Policy
changes.description: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or legal requirements. We will notify you of material changes via email at least 30 days before they take effect. Your continued use of Cyqle after the updated policy takes effect constitutes acceptance of the changes.

contact.title: Privacy Questions or Concerns?
contact.description: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy or wish to exercise your privacy rights, please contact our Data Protection Officer:

cookiesPolicy.title: Cookie Policy
cookiesPolicy.introduction: This Cookie Policy explains how Cyqle uses cookies and similar tracking technologies. We are committed to transparency and giving you full control over your privacy preferences.
cookiesPolicy.complianceBanner: 2026 Compliant - GPC Signal Support & Equal Choice Design

minimal.title: Minimal Tracking
minimal.description: We use only essential cookies and privacy-respecting analytics

gpc.title: GPC Signal Support
gpc.description: We automatically honor Global Privacy Control signals from your browser

choice.title: Equal Choice
choice.description: Accept and Reject buttons have equal visual prominence

control.title: Full Control
control.description: Change your preferences at any time through your browser or our settings

whatAreCookies.title: 1. What Are Cookies?
whatAreCookies.intro: Cookies are small text files that websites store on your device when you visit them. They help websites remember your preferences, improve functionality, and provide analytics.
whatAreCookies.description: Cookies can be "session cookies" (deleted when you close your browser) or "persistent cookies" (stored for a set period). They can be "first-party" (set by the website you're visiting) or "third-party" (set by external services).

cookiesWeUse.title: 2. Cookies We Use
cookiesWeUse.intro: Cyqle uses a minimal set of cookies. On this marketing website (cyqle.in), we use essential cookies and optional analytics. Within the platform application itself, we ONLY use essential session cookies. We do NOT use advertising cookies or sell your data to third parties.

essential.title: Essential Cookies (Required)
essential.intro: These cookies are strictly necessary for the website to function and cannot be disabled without breaking core functionality:

session.name: cyqle_session
session.purpose: Maintains your authenticated session and remembers you're logged in

essential.note: Legal Basis: These cookies are exempt from consent requirements under ePrivacy Directive as they are strictly necessary for service provision.

analytics.title: Analytics Cookies (Optional - Marketing Website Only)
analytics.intro: With your consent, we use privacy-respecting analytics on this marketing website to understand visitor behavior and improve our content. Analytics are NOT used within the Cyqle platform application itself:

plausible.name: Plausible Analytics (cyqle.in only)
plausible.purpose: Tracks aggregate usage statistics on our marketing website without identifying individual users. Does not use cookies or track across websites. NOT used in the platform application.
plausible.duration: No cookies stored (uses local storage with 24-hour expiry)

analytics.note: Important: Analytics are only active on cyqle.in (this marketing website). When you use the Cyqle platform application, NO analytics cookies or tracking are used. You can opt out of marketing website analytics at any time.

noTracking.title: What We DON'T Use
noTracking.item1: No third-party advertising cookies (Google Ads, Facebook Pixel, etc.)
noTracking.item2: No cross-site tracking or retargeting cookies
noTracking.item3: No fingerprinting techniques to identify users
noTracking.item4: No selling or sharing of data with data brokers

gpcSupport.title: 3. Global Privacy Control (GPC) Support
gpcSupport.intro: Cyqle fully supports the Global Privacy Control (GPC) signal as required by 2026 privacy regulations.

whatIsGpc.title: What is GPC?
whatIsGpc.description: Global Privacy Control (GPC) is a browser setting that allows you to automatically opt out of data sharing and sale across all websites you visit. When enabled, your browser sends a "GPC: 1" signal in the HTTP headers.

howItWorks.title: How Cyqle Honors GPC Signals
howItWorks.item1: When we detect a GPC signal, we automatically treat it as if you clicked "Reject All" on our cookie banner
howItWorks.item2: We disable all optional cookies and analytics tracking
howItWorks.item3: Your GPC preference is respected on every page load without requiring additional clicks

enable.title: How to Enable GPC
enable.description: You can enable GPC in the following browsers:
enable.browser1: Brave Browser: Settings → Shields → Global Privacy Control
enable.browser2: Firefox: Install the Global Privacy Control extension
enable.browser3: Chrome/Edge: Install the Global Privacy Control extension

cookieBanner.title: 4. Cookie Banner Design (Symmetry of Choice)
cookieBanner.intro: Under 2026 regulations, cookie consent banners must provide equal prominence to both accepting and rejecting cookies. Our banner complies with these requirements.

symmetry.title: Symmetry of Choice Requirement
symmetry.description: We provide "Accept All" and "Reject All" buttons with equal visual prominence (same size, color intensity, and positioning). Neither option is pre-selected or designed to manipulate your choice.
symmetry.exampleText: We use cookies to improve your experience. You can choose to accept or reject optional cookies.

requirements.title: Design Requirements Met
requirements.item1: Equal button size and visual weight for Accept and Reject options
requirements.item2: No dark patterns (e.g., hiding the reject button, using guilt-inducing language)
requirements.item3: Clear explanation of what each option means
requirements.item4: Easy access to customize granular preferences

managing.title: 5. Managing Your Cookie Preferences
managing.intro: You have full control over your cookie preferences and can change them at any time.

changeMind.title: Change Your Mind Anytime
changeMind.description: You can update your cookie preferences at any time by clicking the "Cookie Settings" link in the footer of our website. Your new preferences will take effect immediately.

browserSettings.title: Browser-Level Cookie Controls
browserSettings.description: Most browsers allow you to manage cookies through their settings:
browserSettings.chrome: Settings → Privacy and security → Cookies and other site data
browserSettings.firefox: Settings → Privacy & Security → Cookies and Site Data
browserSettings.edge: Settings → Cookies and site permissions → Manage and delete cookies
browserSettings.warning: Warning: Blocking all cookies may prevent essential website functionality from working properly.

deleteCookies.title: Deleting Existing Cookies
deleteCookies.description: You can delete all cookies stored by Cyqle at any time through your browser's settings. This will log you out and reset your preferences.

thirdParty.title: 6. Third-Party Services
thirdParty.intro: We use a minimal number of trusted third-party services on our marketing website. The platform application itself does not use any third-party analytics or tracking services.

plausible.title: Plausible Analytics (Marketing Website Only)
plausible.description: We use Plausible Analytics exclusively on cyqle.in (this marketing website) for privacy-respecting analytics. Plausible does not use cookies, does not track users across websites, and is fully GDPR-compliant. This service is NOT used within the platform application.

changes.title: 7. Changes to This Cookie Policy
changes.description: We may update this Cookie Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or legal requirements. We will notify you of material changes via email or a prominent notice on our website at least 30 days before they take effect.

contact.title: Questions About Cookies?
contact.description: If you have questions about our use of cookies or wish to exercise your privacy rights, please contact us:

license.title: 1. License & Scope of Use
license.intro: Your access to Cyqle is governed by the following license terms that define how you may use our platform.

grant.title: License Grant
grant.description: Cyqle grants you a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable, and revocable license to access and use our cloud desktop environments ("jailed environments") subject to these Terms. This license permits you to:
grant.point1: Access isolated virtual desktop sessions through our platform
grant.point2: Install and run software within the resource limits of your subscription tier
grant.point3: Store data within the allocated persistence limits of your plan
grant.point4: Use our API to programmatically manage sessions (paid tiers only)

fairUse.title: Fair Use Policy
fairUse.description: To ensure platform stability and fair resource allocation for all users, the following activities are strictly prohibited within your virtual desktop environment:
fairUse.prohibited1: Cryptocurrency mining or proof-of-work computational tasks
fairUse.prohibited2: Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attacks or participation in botnets
fairUse.prohibited3: Excessive resource consumption that impacts other users (e.g., fork bombs, memory exhaustion attacks)
fairUse.prohibited4: Running services that accept unsolicited inbound connections from the public internet for purposes other than legitimate development, testing, or authorized operations

subscription.title: 2. Subscription & Slot Model
subscription.intro: Cyqle operates on a credit-based slot model where each active session consumes one slot. Understanding how slots work is essential to managing your account.

slotModel.title: How Slots Work
slotModel.description: Our platform architecture is based on a "slot" system:
slotModel.point1: One slot = one active desktop session running at any given time
slotModel.point2: Each subscription tier includes a specific number of concurrent slots
slotModel.point3: When you close a session, the slot becomes available for a new session

free.name: Free Tier:
free.description: Provides limited access with 15-minute session limits, 1 vCPU, 1 GB RAM, no persistence, and low priority queue access. Intended for evaluation purposes only.

paid.name: Paid Tiers (Lite, Pro, Power Tiers):
paid.description: Offer extended or unlimited session durations, increased computational resources, persistent storage with retention periods, high-priority queue access, API access, and unlimited snapshots (Pro and above). Credits are consumed based on active usage time.

billing.title: Billing Models
billing.description: We offer two billing options for paid subscriptions. Monthly Subscription: Pay a fixed monthly price with included credit allocation that resets each billing period. Metered (Pay-as-you-go): Pay only for actual usage time with no recurring charges - buy credits as needed and credits are deducted per minute of session runtime.
